text: Tammy Suzanne Green Baldwin (born Tammy Suzanne Green Baldwin; February 11, 1962) is the junior United States Senator from Wisconsin and a member of the Democratic Party. She previously served as the U.S. Representative from Wisconsin's 2nd congressional district from 1999 to 2013, as well as serving three terms in the Wisconsin Assembly representing the 78th district. Baldwin was born on February 11, 1962 in Madison, Wisconsin. She is of Russian-German descent. Baldwin studied at Smith College and at the University of Wisconsin, Madison. She is the first woman elected to represent Wisconsin in the Senate, and the first openly gay U.S. Senator in history. ==References== ==Other websites== *Senator Tammy Baldwin official U.S. Senate site *Tammy Baldwin for Senate official campaign site *Profile at the Democratic Party of Wisconsin *Tammy Baldwin, Wisconsin Historical Society Category:1962 births Category:Living people Category:Lesbians Category:LGBT people from Wisconsin Category:American LGBT politicians Category:Politicians from Madison, Wisconsin Category:United States representatives from Wisconsin Category:United States senators from Wisconsin Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:State legislators of the United States Category:21st-century American politicians Category:20th-century American politicians
title: Tammy Baldwin
